title: ‘Emmerdale' Spoiler: Ashley Thomas Will Leave Soap Following Dementia Storyline, Actor John Middleton Confirms
text:
‘Emmerdale' Spoiler: Ashley Thomas Will Leave Soap Following Dementia Storyline, Actor John Middleton Confirms The Huffington Post UK | By Rachel McGrath 
As promised, the ‘Emmerdale’ flashback episode revealed a number of shocking truths, and actor John Middleton has now confirmed that he will be leaving the soap following character Ashley Thomas’s dementia storyline. MORE 'EMMERDALE': 
In Thursday’s hour-long special , viewers saw Ashley being told that he may have early onset dementia, and Digital Spy now reports that the diagnosis will be confirmed next month. 
John has played Ashley for 19 years 
Speaking to the website, John explains that he will leave the soap when the storyline draws to a close, stating: "Inevitably it will take me out of the show. Every year I think, 'Should I go?' It's a bit like a footballer - you should only leave the team when you've had a good season. This, if I'm up to it, will provide me with the best season I've had in my life." 
John won’t be disappearing from our screens for a while though, although his exact exit date is yet to be confirmed. 
"In the episode where Ashley is diagnosed, one of his lines is, 'Last time I checked there is no cure' - but it's a very long arc,” John adds. “Time-wise, as far as I know, I'm contracted to the end of next year. Beyond that I don't know. 
"I'm finding the prospect of leaving actually very exciting. It's another roll of the dice. I'm very, very excited about that and I couldn't ask for a better storyline to leave the show on, I really couldn't." 
John has played fan-favourite Ashley since 1996, and been at the centre of a number of huge storylines during his 19 years in the Dales. The flashback episode also delivered another shock surprise, as it was revealed that Paddy has been unfaithful to Rhona. 
Catch up on all the latest ‘Emmerdale’ news and spoilers here . Close 'Emmerdale': Where Are They Now? of   Played: Sadie King (2004-2006) Patsy's popped up in a number of places since her stint on the show, including 2015's 'Celebrity Big Brother'. She also starred in 'Holby City' from 2007 to 2010. Played: Ryan Lamb (2009–2011) After leaving the Dales, James returned to 'Hollyoaks', where he stars as John-Paul McQueen. Played: Emily Kirk (1999-2005, 2006-2008) After quitting the soap, Kate has returned to the Dales on a couple of occasions however she's never made a full comeback. However, since 'Emmerdale', Kate hasn't appeared on TV screens again. Played: Carl King (2004–2012) Tom seems to have put acting on the back-burner recently, and judging from his Twitter, he spends a lot of time working with the charity Hope For Justice. He's also in a band, named Edna's Hat. Played: Kim Tate (1989-1999) After ten years on the soap, resident bad girl Kim left and (appropriately) joined the cast of prison drama 'Bad Girls'. Most recently, Claire appeared in 'Hollyoaks' as Andrea Mason from 2005 to 2012. Played: Chris Tate (1989-2003) Peter has swapped the small screen for the stage, appearing in a number of small productions. Played: Mandy Dingle (1995-2001) Since Lisa left the Dales, she's starred in 'Waterloo Road' and 'Scott And Bailey', as well as getting her dancing shoes on for 'Strictly'. Let's be honest though - the thing we remember most is the fact she provided the voice over for 'You've Been Framed'. Played: Katie Sugden (2001–15) Sammy left the soap in early 2015 - who knows what she'll get up to next? Played: Donna Windsor (1993–2009, 2014) After five years off, Verity reprised her role for a few months in 2014, ahead of the character's death. During her time away from the soap, Verity trod the boards, playing Maria in 'The Sound Of Music', while the show was on tour. Played: Danny Daggert (2001–06, 2007) Cleveland appeared in 'The Bill' shortly after leaving the Dales. He's also popped up on the TV series 'Doctors' and 'Sunshine'. Played: Any Wyatt (2010–13) Prior to her primetime big break on 'Emmerdale', Chelsea starred in the popular TV show 'Byker Grove'. Since leaving, she's appeared in a number of modelling shoots. Played: Eve Jenson (2010–11) In March 2015, Suzanne Shaw announced that she's pregnant with her second child. In 2014 she starred as Tara Fable in the mini-series '5 Aside'. Played: Albert Dingle (1995–98, 2004) Bobby's been a regular on the Panto circuit for years, and in 2008 he published his autobiography, which was followed by a sequel in 2010. He also lends his voice to the Tetly Tea ads. Played: Kelly Windsor (1993–2000, 2005–07, 2011) Troublemaker Kelly returned to cause trouble in the village a number of times. During her time away, Adele tried her hand at modelling, starring in a number of lads' mag shoots, and also starred on reality TV shows such as 'Celebrity Fear Factor' and 'The Salon'. Played: Sean Reynolds (1999-2002) Fans of 'Call The Midwife' will recognise Stephen, as he plays Dr Turner in the series. Played: Viv Hope (1993–2011) Deena reappeared on our TV screens in an episode of 'True Crime', but you're more likely to find her on stage now. She's appeared in a number of pantomimes, and also trod the boards as one of the Calendar Girls. Played: Hazel Rhodes (2010-2012) Pauline resumed her role as Sharon in hit comedy 'Birds Of A Feather' when the show returned in 2014. She also scored a part in ITV's drama 'Broadchurch. Played: Steph Stokes (2002–06, 2013) Lorraine's acting credits include 'My Family' and 'Doctors. In her time away from the fictional farming village, she also gave camping in the 'I'm A Celeb' jungle a go, before popping up on 'Celebrity Come Dine With Me'. Played: Scott Windsor (1993–96, 1998–2007) After 'Emmerdale', Ben - successfully - tried his hand at stage acting, and he's trod the boards after landing roles in 'Romeo And Juliet' and 'Legally Blonde', among others. Played: Jasmine Thomas (2005–09) Jenna is one of the soap's most successful exports, and she currently stars in 'Doctor Who' opposite Peter Capaldi.  Share
